data.text:
Meet the GRAPPA Research Committee

The GRAPPA Research Committee is advisory with the overarching role of driving

and supporting research within the GRAPPA organization through a collaborative research network.

Research Committee Leadership

Kurt de Vlam, MD, PhD

Rheumatologist Research Committee Co-Chair

KU Leuven

Belgium

Vinod Chandran, MBBS, MD, DM, PhD, FRCPC

Rheumatologist Research Committee Co-Chair

University of Toronto

Canada

Wilson Liao, MD

Dermatologist Research Committee Co-Chair

University of California San Francisco

USA

Research Project Submission Process

Instructions for Submitting a Letter of Intent for Research Project Review:

Prepare a brief Letter of Intent (2-3 pages maximum) that includes the following information:

- Project title

- Principal investigator(s) and institutional affiliation(s)

- Brief background and rationale for the proposed research

- Specific aims/objectives

- Potential impact and significance

- Estimated budget range

- Proposed project timeline

The GRAPPA Research Committee Co-Chairs will review the Letter of Intent and respond with feedback within one week of submission.

If the Letter of Intent is approved, you will be invited to submit a full research proposal. A Research Proposal Submission Template can be found here to clarify the required information.

The full research proposal will undergo a comprehensive review by members of the GRAPPA Research Committee. A final decision will be provided within one month of receiving the complete proposal.

Please note that approval of the Letter of Intent does not guarantee funding or final approval of the full research proposal. The Letter of Intent is intended to provide an initial evaluation of the project's alignment with GRAPPA's research priorities and feasibility. If you have any further questions, please contact the GRAPPA Research Committee Co-Chairs at [email protected].

Key questions, projects, and activities this group oversees:

Organizing the Trainee Symposium/Abstract selection at the Annual Meeting.

Organizing/reviewing the GRAPPA Pilot Grant awards.

GRAPPA Collaborative Research Network (CRN).

The GRAPPA Research Committee is identified as a scientific advisory committee. The objective of the RC is to provide independent advice and peer review to the GRAPPA Board and GRAPPA membership on the scientific, clinical and financial aspects of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis research. The RC will inform on recent research and research-related policy, advise on industry trends and emerging research projects, disseminate information about GRAPPA-sponsored research and programs, and provide input on which research projects to fund.

Use Shift+Tab to go back
